label: time periods
definition: Geologic time periods and seasons of the year

children.label: Phanerozoic
children.definition: Eon of geologic time approximately 542 million years ago extending to the present. https://doi.org/10.3133/fs20103059

children.label: Cenozoic
children.definition: Era of geologic time approximately 65 million years ago extending to the present. https://doi.org/10.3133/fs20103059

children.label: Quaternary
children.definition: Period of geologic time approximately 2.6 million years ago extending to the present. In new studies, this term is deprecated in favor of Holocene and Pleistocene. https://doi.org/10.3133/fs20103059

children.label: Holocene
children.definition: Epoch of geologic time approximately 11 thousand years ago extending to the present. https://doi.org/10.3133/fs20103059

children.label: Pleistocene
children.definition: Epoch of geologic time approximately 2.6 million to 11 thousand years ago. https://doi.org/10.3133/fs20103059

children.label: Tertiary
children.definition: Period of geologic time approximately 65 to 1.8 million years ago. In new studies, this term is deprecated in favor of Neogene and Paleogene. https://doi.org/10.3133/fs20103059

children.label: Neogene
children.definition: Subperiod of geologic time approximately 23 to 2.6 million years ago. https://doi.org/10.3133/fs20103059

children.label: Miocene
children.definition: Epoch of geologic time approximately 23 to 5.3 million years ago. https://doi.org/10.3133/fs20103059

children.label: Pliocene
children.definition: Epoch of geologic time approximately 5.3 to 2.6 million years ago. https://doi.org/10.3133/fs20103059

children.label: Paleogene
children.definition: Subperiod of geologic time approximately 65 to 23 million years ago. https://doi.org/10.3133/fs20103059

children.label: Eocene
children.definition: Epoch of geologic time approximately 56 to 34 million years ago. https://doi.org/10.3133/fs20103059

children.label: Oligocene
children.definition: Epoch of geologic time approximately 34 to 23 million years ago. https://doi.org/10.3133/fs20103059

children.label: Paleocene
children.definition: Epoch of geologic time approximately 65 to 56 million years ago. https://doi.org/10.3133/fs20103059

children.label: Mesozoic
children.definition: Era of geologic time approximately 251 to 65 million years ago. https://doi.org/10.3133/fs20103059

children.label: Cretaceous
children.definition: Period of geologic time approximately 145 to 65 million years ago. https://doi.org/10.3133/fs20103059

children.label: Jurassic
children.definition: Period of geologic time approximately 200 to 145 million years ago. https://doi.org/10.3133/fs20103059

children.label: Triassic
children.definition: Period of geologic time approximately 251 to 200 million years ago. https://doi.org/10.3133/fs20103059

children.label: Paleozoic
children.definition: Era of geologic time approximately 542 to 251 million years ago. https://doi.org/10.3133/fs20103059

children.label: Cambrian
children.definition: Period of geologic time approximately 542 to 488 million years ago. https://doi.org/10.3133/fs20103059

children.label: Devonian
children.definition: Period of geologic time approximately 416 to 359 million years ago. https://doi.org/10.3133/fs20103059

children.label: Mississippian
children.definition: Subperiod of geologic time approximately 359 to 318 million years ago. https://doi.org/10.3133/fs20103059

children.label: Ordovician
children.definition: Period of geologic time approximately 488 to 444 million years ago. https://doi.org/10.3133/fs20103059

children.label: Pennsylvanian
children.definition: Subperiod of geologic time approximately 318 to 299 million years ago. https://doi.org/10.3133/fs20103059

children.label: Permian
children.definition: Period of geologic time approximately 299 to 251 million years ago. https://doi.org/10.3133/fs20103059

children.label: Silurian
children.definition: Period of geologic time approximately 444 to 416 million years ago. https://doi.org/10.3133/fs20103059

children.label: Precambrian
children.definition: General interval of geologic time before approximately 542 million years ago. https://doi.org/10.3133/fs20103059

children.label: Archaean
children.definition: Eon of geologic time approximately 4 to 2.5 billion years ago. https://doi.org/10.3133/fs20103059

children.label: Hadean
children.definition: Eon of geologic time prior to 4 billion years ago. https://doi.org/10.3133/fs20103059

children.label: Proterozoic
children.definition: Eon of geologic time approximately 2.5 billion to 542 million years ago. https://doi.org/10.3133/fs20103059

children.label: Neoproterozoic
children.definition: Era of geologic time approximately 1 billion to 542 million years ago. https://doi.org/10.3133/fs20103059

children.label: Ediacaran
children.definition: The last geological period of the Neoproterozoic Era, just before the Cambrian Period of the Paleozoic Era.

children.label: Mesoproterozoic
children.definition: Era of geologic time approximately 1.6 to 1 billion years ago. https://doi.org/10.3133/fs20103059

children.label: Paleoproterozoic
children.definition: Era of geologic time approximately 2.5 to 1.6 billion years ago. https://doi.org/10.3133/fs20103059

label: institutional structures and activities
definition: Organizational characteristics, services, activities and physical infrastructure, primarily focused on those of the USGS

children.label: facilities
children.definition: Location, character, and general use of the physical offices used to carry out research, monitoring, and administration

children.label: field offices
children.definition: Small branch of a science center not located at the headquarters of the science center

children.label: sample repositories
children.definition: Organized and curated collections of physical materials such as drill cores, rock samples, thin sections, and biological samples.

children.label: national centers
children.definition: Research and monitoring office with a mission of nationwide scope

children.label: science centers
children.definition: Organizational units that carry out research or monitoring

children.label: science discipline offices
children.definition: Offices coordinating activities focused on traditional academic categories

children.label: regional offices
children.definition: Multidisciplinary management offices overseeing specified geographic area

children.label: support offices
children.definition: Organizational units that carry out administrative functions rather than research or monitoring

children.label: mission directorates
children.definition: Offices charged with coordinating a variety of scientific activities focused on strategic objectives that may cross traditional scientific discipline boundaries.

children.label: science programs
children.definition: Broadly organized scientific research and monitoring activities

children.label: partnerships
children.definition: Formal collaborative relationships between USGS and other organizations

children.label: interagency programs
children.definition: Ongoing organizational activities in which USGS works directly with other government agencies

children.label: interdisciplinary programs
children.definition: Major research and monitoring activities focused on topics that cross or integrate multiple traditional academic categories

children.label: international programs
children.definition: Organizational activities that USGS undertakes with cooperation and support of foreign governments or multinational organizations

children.label: external research support
children.definition: Research carried out by external organizations or individuals through contracts or grants

children.label: citizen science programs
children.definition: Observation or monitoring activities that include contributions from amateur or non-professional scientists or other citizen volunteers.

children.label: standards development
children.definition: Creation and maintenance of formal specifications by which research and monitoring are carried out

children.label: customer support and user feedback
children.definition: Web sites focusing on assistance to users of USGS information products

children.label: application programming interfaces
children.definition: Internet services providing subsets of data in response to specific web requests.  For APIs that are not accessible through the internet, use scientific software.

children.label: map interfaces
children.definition: Online interfaces showing interactive maps and geospatial information

children.label: web map services
children.definition: Internet services providing geospatial information that conform to formally defined specifications, for use in GIS and mapping software.

children.label: sales and distribution services
children.definition: Online services by which products may be purchased

children.label: search services
children.definition: Automated information search systems

children.label: news services
children.definition: Summaries of time-sensitive information of interest to the public, may include short audio or video presentations, may provide subscription services

children.label: publishing
children.definition: Policies and procedures by which information is reviewed, approved, formatted for public distribution.
